page.title: 10Oil Wells in Fife
page.content:
In the Autumn of{1981}test bores reconfirmed the discovery of oil (previously discovered in the{Second {World War,}and again in{1965)}in the region of{Calais Farm}and{Dulloch} {Farm,}to the south-east of Dunfermline.
Previously, there was not thought to be enough oil to be drilled commercially, but with escalating oil prices, and the fact that the oil is on land and not much deeper down than five hundred feet, the companies which have license for fifty-nine thousand acres in west and central Fife, North {Sea petroleums}and{Pacific Basins (UK) believe that it may well be worth drilling for what oil is there. It is not known what they have decided at the present time.
